## Giarratani Rising Star Award

The Industry Studies Association offers annual recognition for emerging researchers through the Giarratani Rising Star Award.

### Award Details

- **First Prize:** $1,000 honorarium
- **Runner-up Prize:** $500 honorarium
- Non-winning papers may still qualify for the regular conference program

### Eligibility Requirements

Applicants must meet the following criteria:

- Junior scholars no more than six years post-Ph.D.
- At least one co-author who is an early career scholar
- Papers cannot have been previously accepted for publication
- Individual scholars may submit only one paper to the competition

### Evaluation Criteria

The award committee assesses two main areas:

1. Evidence of significant personal investment in developing an understanding of the markets, firms and institutions within relevant industries
2. Demonstration of combining direct interaction and observation with appropriate theory and analysis

### Submission Process

Candidates must complete three mandatory steps:

1. Submit via [Microsoft's Academic Conference Management Toolkit (CMT)](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/ISA2026/)
2. Upload an extended abstract and designate "Giarratani Rising Star Award" in the submission form
3. Register for the conference and confirm attendance by early March

**Submission Deadline:** January 16, 2026

### Important Note

Non-completion of any requirement results in automatic disqualification.
